description: Dive into "Shopping Adventures in Kuala Lumpur's Malls" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Shopping Adventures in Kuala Lumpur's Malls

places.generalDescription: Pavilion Kuala Lumpur is a massive, high-end shopping destination located in the heart of the trendy Bukit Bintang district. This sprawling 1.37 million square feet complex houses luxury and mainstream retailers as well as numerous global dining options. The mall, which opened in September 2007, is a prominent feature of the city center and includes a retail mall, an office block, and two residential towers. It's surrounded by upscale hotels and is known for its vibrant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Two other Pavilion malls have mushroomed up in the Klang Valley since Time Out last updated our guide, but in our humble opinion, the first is still the best. Pavilion Kuala Lumpur stands out even in the shopping district of Bukit Bintang with an inimitable mix of high-end and high-street fashion, restaurants and bars. There are 700 stores spread over ten levels and nine “precincts”, each offering a different shopping experience: find al fresco dining options including the city’s only Five Guys at the Connection “precinct”, or head up to Tokyo Street for Japanese restaurants and speciality stores.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in KL

sources.snippet: The  grand dame of luxury shopping in the heart of Kuala Lumpur has to be Pavilion Kuala Lumpur. Located along the Bukit Bintang main vein, this expansive palatial paradise consecrated to luxury retail opened its doors to the public in 2007 and has become an undisputed landmark in the city ever since. Sporting a grand foyer that invites all to explore within, you’ll find physical retail outlets for most major high fashion names here, from Hermes, to Chopard and Henry Jacques.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur: How to get there

sources.snippet: Located in the heart of Bukit Bintang, Pavilion Kuala Lumpur is where luxury shopping meets the city’s dynamic energy. From the moment you spot the celebrated PavilionCrystal Fountain—the largest in Malaysia—you know you’re in for a treat. Inside, sleek marble floors and towering atriums house over 700 stores, including international luxury names like Prada, Hermès, and Gucci, alongside high-street favourites such as Zara and Nike.
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur’s Top Shopping Malls: Insider Tips

sources.snippet: Discover world-class, award-winning experiences in the heart of Bukit Bintang, the shopping paradise of Malaysia. Blending the best of international and local retail, Pavilion Kuala Lumpur is the defining authority in fashion, food, and urban leisure. With over 700 stores spread over ten levels and eight themed precincts, embrace your senses with the finest at this landmark capital of style.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia

sources.snippet: There are several Pavilion malls in the city – Bukit Jalil, Damansara Heights, and Kuala Lumpur, to be precise. But Pavilion KL is the OG one that mall rats flock to for the 700 shops it has that cover lifestyle, fashion, tech, and more. Some of the stores to uncover here are Malaysia’s first PopMart store, as well as a K-pop cafe and album retail shop called Notes by YGM.

sources.snippet: We have a joke in the family about shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur – There’s a shopping mall every kilometre in Kuala Lumpur. Pavilion Kuala Lumpur is that mall within walking distance of KLCC in the KL Golden Triangle district (KLCC, Bukit Bintang, Menara). Pavilion Kuala Lumpur is a premier shopping destination in KL that offers a mix of luxury and mid-range brands.

places.name: Pavilion Kuala Lumpur

reviews.text: My wife and I are currently visiting KL and our hotel is just next to this huge and very popular mall in Bukit Bintang. We last visited this mall in 2017 and we are happy to see that it is still going strong with retail and food and beverage shops aplenty - from the expensive ones to the affordable ones, and from the global branded ones to the local branded ones to the independent ones. And we are impressed that it also houses 2 big food courts therein - Food Republic and Food Place. And there is even a Tokyo Street for many many things Japanese. This mall is certainly THE place to shop and dine at in KL.

Pavilion Kuala Lumpur is like the Times Square of KL but in a more upscale and modern way. It's bustling, lively and full of energy with tons of shopping options from luxury brands to popular international chains.

The mall's layout is easy to navigate the food choices are fantastic and the overall vibe feels very cosmopolitan and vibrant. It's definitely one of the top places to visit if you want a premium shopping and dining experience in Kuala Lumpur.

Perfect spot for both locals and tourists looking for the latest trends and good food!

Pavilion Mall in Kuala Lumpur is an absolute delight for shoppers and tourists! From high-end international brands to trendy local shops, it has everything under one roof. The mall is beautifully designed, very clean, and gives a luxurious feel. The food court and restaurants offer a wide variety of delicious options from all around the world. It's centrally located in Bukit Bintang and perfect for spending a full day - shopping, dining, and even just relaxing. The festive decorations and events are always amazing too. Highly recommended for anyone visiting KL!

places.address: 168, Bukit Bintang Rd, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Suria KLCC, a 6-storey shopping hub that opened in 1998, is a popular destination for both locals and tourists of all ages. Situated next to the iconic PETRONAS Twin Towers, the mall offers designer boutiques and international restaurants. Visitors can explore indoor attractions like the Petrosains Discovery Center and Aquaria KLCC, or enjoy outdoor activities at the lush 50-acre KLCC Park.

sources.snippet: Situated at the base of the Petronas Twin Towers is Suria KLCC, Malaysia’s most iconic shopping destination and as good a place as any to begin a fashion — and architecture — tour of the city. It spans over one million square feet, and with more than 340 specialty stores, shoppers are spoiled for choice stumbling upon treasures from local designers, international brands, and more. If money’s no object, the literature and graphic novels at Books Kinokuniya go into the cart, plus atmos’ shiny sleek sneakers and Le Labo’s artisanal scents.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in KL

sources.snippet: Suria KLCC is a haven for locals and tourists, both young and old due to its strategic location next to the PETRONAS Twin Towers, and its offerings both indoors and outdoors. Within the mall, there’s the Petrosains Discovery Center and Aquaria KLCC, while outdoors, there’s KLCC Park, a lush, 50-acre area of lush greenery which includes an impressive children’s playground, a lovely wading pool which is a hit with young ones, a jogging track, sculptures, and the Esplanade, a 10,000 square feet man-made Lake Symphony where two musical fountains display over 150 unique programmed animations in a magical performance of sound and water. For the musically-inclined, there’s also the Malaysian Philharmonic Orchestra next door.
sources.shortName: Best Malls For Families In Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Easily one of the best shopping malls in KL, KLCC Suria has six storeys of shopping from luxury goods to food courts plus top attractions like KLCC Aquarium. KLCC Suria is a sublime way to shop (and a great KL rainy day activity) with over 350 stores including flagship brands such as Coach, Chanel, Gucci and Prada. If luxury shopping isn’t for you, there is still lots to do here including lots of food options like a food court, high class dining plus lots more affordable options like McDonalds and Nandos!
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

sources.snippet: Next to the Petronas Towers, the most popular attraction of the city, you will find the shopping mall Suria KLCC. As many expats and tourists walk around in this area many shops in this mall are aimed at international travelers. On the lowest floor at concourse level you will find banking services, a pharmacy, supermarkets, convenience and takeaway food, perfumeries like Dior, jewelries and mainstream fashion shops like the Zara. All the essentials for the international traveler who are passing through.
sources.shortName: Shopping in Malaysia: the best shopping malls of Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: The crescent-shaped Suria KLCC located at the base of the 88-storey, steel-clad Petronas Twin Towers (which rise to 451.9m) is more than just a shopping and dining venture with spectacular water fountain show and an array of luxury brands. Hence, Suria KLCC is definitely on the bucket list of all the tourists. Also the fact that it is so close to KLCC Park and the KL Convention Centre: and with a light rail transit (LRT) station set adjacent to the building, the Suria KLCC mall is easy to reach.

places.name: Suria KLCC

reviews.text: A nice mall here which is in the towers. The areas around the mall are nice for raking photos. It's lit up well in the night. The fountain show is held in the evening. The park around also is a nice walk. All top brands are available in this mall but mostly none are on discount.

Suria KLCC is one of the most popular shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur. It is located in the heart of the city, right next to the Petronas Twin Towers.

The mall has many shops, from luxury brands to more affordable stores, so everyone can find something they like. It is clean, modern, and well-maintained.

There are lots of restaurants and cafes that serve both local and international food. There is also a large food court with cheaper choices. Suria KLCC also has fun attractions like Aquaria KLCC (an aquarium), a cinema, and the Petrosains Science Centre, which are great for families and children.

It is easy to get there, especially by LRT (light rail transit). At night, the view of the Twin Towers from the mall is very beautiful.

Overall, Suria KLCC is a great place to shop, eat, and spend time with family or friends. It is highly recommended for both tourists and locals. ❤️

Lots of high end shops and a great food hall spread over six floors. Highly recommended Lavender bakery. Sits beneath the iconic PETRONAS Twin Towers and leads into both KLCC Park and Aquaria KLCC via tunnels.

places.generalDescription: Mid Valley Megamall is a shopper's paradise that offers a diverse range of retail experiences. It houses over 400 retailers in twelve categories, including fashion, lifestyle, home furnishings, cosmetics, and healthcare essentials. This mall is not just for shopping; it also features dining options and entertainment facilities like an 18-screen cinema. Located between the city center and Klang Valley, it is part of a large urban development project that includes office blocks and hotels.

sources.snippet: The megamall, covering 1.7 million square feet, houses more than 630 shops, restaurants, and service outlets over six floors, plus a cinema and a convention centre. For shopping, its fashion folio encompasses everything from homegrown labels Dressing Paula to high-street giants H&M, Uniqlo, and Zara. Sportswear is also popular at the megamall, with stores by adidas, asics, JD Sports, New Balance, Nike and Under Armour.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in KL

sources.snippet: This is a shopper’s paradise, fashionista’s haven, kid’s wonderland, gourmet hunter’s sanctuary and a firm family favourite, all under one roof. Mid Valley Megamall is home to a myriad of retail experiences unlike any other, ranging from a dazzling array of fashion and lifestyle innovations to home furnishings, cosmetics and healthcare essentials to wining, dining and all things entertainment. With 1.7 million square feet nett lettable and over four hundred retailers in twelve categories, there are plenty to keep devoted shoppers grinning.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia

sources.snippet: Another shopping mall in KL that makes shopping in Malaysia a fun-filled affair is the Mid Valley Megamall. Nestled halfway between the city center and Klang Valley, the mall is part of one of the largest urban development projects in the country and features an office block, 30 signature offices, and 3 hotels alongside the shopping mall. With a total of 430 stores spread across five floors and an 18-screen Golden Screen Cinema, this is a mall that has it all.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Malls In Kuala Lumpur Every Shopper Should Visit

sources.snippet: One of the biggest malls we’ve been to in KL, Megamall certainly lives up to its name with over 600 stores, restaurants and even a colossal cinema across 6 floors. Popular with Malaysian families, Mid Valley Megamall is a one stop shopping center where you can shop for fashion in stores like H&M, Uniqlo, adidas and Nike then hit up one of the dozens of restaurants. The food court near the cinema has to be seen to be believed with lots of dining options.

reviews.text:
My family finds Mid Valley Megamall a convenient spot for our diverse needs. We appreciate the wide array of shops, catering to both our teenager's fashion interests and my spouse's electronics hunt. The food options are plentiful, making it easy to find something everyone likes for lunch. While it can get crowded, especially on weekends, the ample parking helps.

What other Google reviews says:
for Mid Valley Megamall frequently mention its vast size and extensive selection of retail stores, covering fashion, electronics, and more. The diverse food and beverage options are often highlighted as a major draw. Many reviewers comment on its crowded nature, particularly during peak hours, but also appreciate the good accessibility and parking facilities. Some reviews also note the presence of a cinema and other entertainment options.

Its a big shopping centre located at Mid valley.  Many food options and famous brands retail shops. There Cinema, Bowling Alley. There also Aeon shopping within. Easy connection from LRT/KTM toward the mall. Good to spend some good hours inside the mall.

I'm really enjoyed my shopping at Midvalley this round. Usually I'm didn't shop much here. But this August month really spent on here. Usually go over here just for money changer and eat food.. But this round I spent more then before.

places.generalDescription: 1 Utama Shopping Centre, situated in Bandar Utama Township, Malaysia, is a colossal mall that boasts over 700 shops spread across 5 million square feet and 6 expansive retail levels. As the seventh-largest mall globally, it offers an opulent shopping experience with a wide array of high-end international chains, department stores, and dining options. Additionally, visitors can enjoy entertainment facilities such as cinemas and a rooftop garden.

sources.snippet: 1 Utama Shopping Centre, spread over six million square feet, is still Kuala Lumpur’s biggest shopping mall. Whether you're in the market for the city’s best bagel, a Furla bag or a POP MART figurine, 1U is a one-stop destination for shopping, dining, and play away from the hot Kuala Lumpur sun. It also has not one, but two cinemas; Malaysia’s largest in-mall performing arts centre PJPAC; an indoor surf park FlowRider; an indoor skydiving center WINDLAB; Asia’s largest indoor rock-climbing gym Camp5; a rollerskating rink; a futsal field, and the list goes on.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in KL

sources.snippet: Spread across 5 million square feet of space and six retail levels, and touted as one of the top 10 largest in the world, 1 Utama Shopping Center has a dizzying number of options if you’re looking for something to do with the whole family. Outdoor enthusiasts can head to Asia’s largest indoor rock climbing gym, Camp5 and climb away, or try their hand at baseball and softball at It’s A Hit Batting Cage. For futsal fans, there are five futsal courts on the upper roof known as Padang@1U.

places.name: 1 Utama Shopping Centre

reviews.text:
This mega mall was truly an eye-opener for me. After walking around for over six hours, I still only managed to cover about 80% of its massive 5.5 million square feet. It's packed with shops, restaurants, cafés, supermarkets - you name it.

The layout can be a little overwhelming, especially if it is your first or second visit, so taking your time to explore both the old sections and the newly revamped wings is key. If you are in Petaling Jaya, it's definitely a spot worth checking out.

Went to next gen theme park and enjoyed the mall as well. It has almost all great brands, a superstore and an excellent food court
Pros:
1- next gen theme park for kids.
2- arcade games for kids
3- grocery store with great prices.
4- excellent food area with kfc, burger king, McDonald's, Texas chicken , Dunkin donut, Starbucks etc..
5- enjoyed shopping as well
6- not very crowded.

I had a wonderful visit to 1 Utama Shopping Centre. This massive mall truly has everything under one roof-endless shops, eateries, and entertainment options. The layout can feel overwhelming at first, but exploring each section was part of the fun. I loved how clean and well-maintained the place is, with plenty of signage to guide visitors. Whether shopping, dining, or just strolling, there's always something new to discover here. Definitely a five-star experience and worth spending hours in!

places.generalDescription: When in Kuala Lumpur, a visit to Berjaya Times Square is a must for those looking for a diverse shopping experience. Located in the heart of the city, this destination offers an array of fashion, food, electronics, and entertainment options. From well-known international brands like Nike and Esprit to local flea market finds, there's something for every shopper here. Additionally, it boasts the largest indoor theme park with separate zones for both adults and kids – making it an ideal family-friendly attraction.

sources.snippet: Times Square – just around the corner from Sungei Wang – is so huge it has an indoor theme park complete with roller coaster. It also has the largest Borders bookshop in the world and so many other stores it’s almost overwhelming.

places.name: Berjaya Times Square

reviews.text:
The reasonably priced shopping mall at KLCC. Tourists often get dropped here before airport drop, hence is a good place to do some affordable shopping and also get soveniours. They also have some sale at the ground floor and cute stores like Miniso and OhSome in the upper floors.

They have one of the best rate money changers "Suria Muhabat" in the first floor. Hence a good option to exchange off all the left out money after you are done with final shopping.

Berjaya Times Square Mall
Berjaya Times Square is a huge and fun mall in Kuala Lumpur. It has over 1,000 shops, lots of places to eat, and many entertainment options
The mall is always lively, especially on weekends and holidays, although the upper floors can be a bit quiet sometimes .

Plenty to do – shop, eat, play, ride-you name it!

Convenient transport link – right next to monorail station.

Great for families and friends – theme park and games are fun for all ages.

Lots of food choices – from food courts to cafes and restaurants.

Room for improvement – some upper-level shops are empty and it gets crowded.

Overall, it's a lively, exciting place to shop and have fun in KL - almost perfect, with just a few quiet corners.

An All-in-One Shopping & Entertainment Paradise!

Berjaya Times Square Mall is a must-visit destination in Kuala Lumpur! This massive shopping complex offers everything under one roof - from trendy fashion outlets, electronics, and beauty stores to a wide variety of delicious food options.

What sets this mall apart is the indoor theme park, which is perfect for families and kids. The roller coaster inside the mall is a unique and thrilling experience! 🎢

The mall also has convenient access via Imbi Monorail station, making transportation super easy. Whether you're here for shopping, dining, movies, or just sightseeing, Berjaya Times Square won't disappoint. It's especially great for budget shopping with plenty of local and international brands.

Highly recommended for tourists and locals alike! 💯🛍️🍽️

places.generalDescription: Sunway Pyramid is a massive mall with an Egyptian theme, offering a wide array of retail stores, dining options, and entertainment facilities. The facade of the mall is stunning and it houses numerous attractions such as Sunway Pyramid Ice for ice skating, Galactic Laser for laser tag, Stars Archery, and Sunway Mega Lanes for bowling. Families can also enjoy The Parenthood, an indoor play center for children. Additionally, there are indoor playgrounds and a mini amusement park on the Lower Ground Floor.

sources.snippet: In Petaling Jaya, Sunway Pyramid is a favourite amongst locals — not simply for an Egyptian-inspired architectural style featuring a giant sphinx statue, or the ice-skating rink that attracts about 15,000 skaters monthly, nor the connecting sprawling Sunway Lagoon amusement park with a water zone, wildlife zoo, rides and more. Here, you’ll find mums and nannies carrying bags laden with fresh produce from Jaya Grocer; young students from neighbouring colleges and universities with H&M, Monki, and Uniqlo shopping bags; and yuppies upgrading their iPhones at Machines or the other tech stores. A curated mix of cafés and restaurants, including Din Tai Fung, Ole-Ole Bali, and iconic chef Gordon Ramsay’s first Bar & Grill outside of the United Kingdom, means the mall is always buzzing at meal times.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in KL

sources.snippet: This Egyptian-inspired mall which a stunning façade boasts four million square feet of retail, entertainment and leisure outlets, and is home to a number of attractions including a world class ice skating rink Sunway Pyramid Ice, Galactic Laser for a fun laser tag game, Stars Archery, Sunway Mega Lanes for some bowling, and a large indoor soft play center and children retail area known as The Parenthood. On the Lower Ground Floor, there is also an indoor playground, and a mini amusement park with train rides, bumper cars, merry go round, ferry wheel and more. For parents with toddlers who tend to be little runners, Sunway Pyramid is one of the few malls that offers a child safety device in the form of a Child Distance Monitor and wristband.
sources.shortName: Best Malls For Families In Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Fun Fact- Sunway Pyramid can be considered as one of the largest shopping centres in the country and the only one with an indoor ice skating rink. One of the specialities of Sunway Pyramid Shopping Mall is that it is build on a massive 1.7 million- sq. ft area, Sunway Pyramid Shopping Mall is an Egyptian-themed mall situated adjacent to Sunway Lagoon Theme Park in Bandar Sunway, Subang Jaya with a mix of local and mass brands provide its visitors with the balance of budget along with luxury.

sources.snippet: Although there are many things to do in Kuala Lumpur, if you're a shopaholic, then keeping a visit to Sunway Pyramid on your to-do list has to be the number one choice. In fact, Sunway Pyramid opened in the year 1997 and became a favorite amongst travelers for its ice rink and various other facilities. In fact, Sunway Pyramid is home to Malaysia's only ice rink and features a number of other facilities like its supermarket, and an array of independent stores to fascinate visitors.

sources.snippet: Sunway Pyramid, Malaysia’s first Egyptian-themed shopping and entertainment mall, underwent a magnificent transformation in 1997 to become the largest shopping mall in Malaysia. Covering 4.3 million square feet and 7 floors, it offers a retail extravaganza across 4 shopping precincts: Fashion Central, Oasis Boulevard, Asian Avenue, and Marrakesh. The first floor features 100,000 square feet of family-friendly F&B, retail offerings, and a child enrichment and edutainment center.

places.name: Sunway Pyramid Shopping Mall

reviews.text:
Sunway Pyramid is a high-end shopping mall with a unique and luxurious atmosphere. The design is inspired by ancient Egyptian architecture, complete with grand statues and intricate carvings. The mall is spacious and well-maintained, making it a pleasant place to shop and explore.

One of the standout features is the indoor ambiance-there's a forest-like setting with birds chirping and the soothing sound of flowing water, creating a relaxing shopping experience.

For entertainment, the mall offers an impressive ice skating rink, which is great for both beginners and experienced skaters. There are also plenty of dining options, ranging from popular international brands to local delicacies, ensuring there's something for everyone.

Even small details stand out here-like their uniquely designed washroom signboards, which add to the mall's creative and themed atmosphere.

With a great mix of luxury and mid-range retail stores, Sunway Pyramid is a must-visit destination whether you're shopping, dining, or just looking for a fun day out!

Sunway Pyramid Mall is a great place to shop for quality, branded items at affordable prices. There are many stores to choose from, and you can find a wide variety of products.

It's definitely worth a visit if you're looking for good deals and a nice shopping experience. Highly recommend!

I loved this mall!! Compared to other malls, these stores were pricier, but there was a large variety of shops and restaurants. The ground floor mainly had a lot luxury shops (if that's your style), but personally, I really liked the Asian corner on the top floor. It had smaller clothing shops which sold reasonably priced cute modern tops and dresses.

sources.snippet: Serving retail indulgences for the many, MyTOWN boasts a list of well-loved retailers housed in its retail space. Swedish home furnishing giant IKEA, Malaysia’s largest cinema chain Golden Screen Cinemas and premium grocery store Village Grocer are some of the selected anchor tenants that can be discovered among the many retail establishments at MyTOWN. As a go-to place for leisure and social meetings, MyTOWN offers fun for family and friends featuring a sunken garden with step seating, semi-covered event pavilion, landscaped outdoor park, international dining at an alfresco dining terrace, children’s play area.

MyTOWN Shopping Centre, located at 6, Jalan Cochrane, Kuala Lumpur, is a massive mall, spanning 20 football fields, with a vast array of shops, from H&M and ZARA to Malaysia's largest IKEA. It offers over 400 dining options, including dLaksa, Nando's, and kid-friendly Weaning Tots with play areas. Entertainment includes Golden Screen Cinemas, VR experiences, and playgrounds, plus a 2-acre park for events. Directly above Cochrane MRT station, it's highly accessible by public transport or car with 6,500 parking bays. The mall is clean and modern but can get crowded during peak times. A minor drawback is the lack of shade at parking ticket dispensers. Overall, MyTOWN is a vibrant, family-friendly destination for shopping, dining, and fun.

Boasting 400 stores spread across seven levels, the mall is divided into three precincts dedicated to food, retail outlets, and events. The Commune section hosts various events, pop-ups, and workshops.

sources.snippet: Among all the Kuala Lumpur shopping malls on this list, Sunway Velocity Mall is easily the shiniest. With its official opening in 2016, this nine-storey mall covering almost 1 million square ft features an eye-catching neo-futuristic exterior. Sunway Velocity also has a covered walkway to two MRT stations (Cochrane and Maluri), making it a highly accessible shopping paradise.

sources.snippet: Sunway Velocity Mall is a lifestyle destination that combines all the vibrancy and excitement of Malaysia’s capital city, Kuala Lumpur. With its cutting-edge architecture, neo-futuristic façade, and contemporary interior design. Image credit: Sunway Velocity Mall Facebook

sources.snippet: A short Grab taxi ride away to the east of central Kuala Lumpur is the Sunway Velocity Mall. This was one of our favourite malls in the city. We visited just as it had opened on a Tuesday morning and it was very chilled out, nearly empty and had everything we needed.
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Shopping - Our Guide to the Best Malls and Markets

sources.snippet: Sunway Velocity Mall is one of the newest kids on the block and one of the glitziest shopping centers in Kuala Lumpur. Opening officially in 2016, this 9 storied mall has more than 1 million square feet of space. Sunway Velocity Mall (image courtesy: wikipedia.org)

sources.snippet: Sunway Velocity takes a modern approach to improving your shopping experience. Everything is contemporary, from its avante-garde architecture to its interior design. This one-million-square-foot mall has more than 500 retail stores across its nine stories.
sources.shortName: Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur for Families

sources.snippet: Don’t confuse Sunway Velocity Mall with Sunway Pyramid Mall. These are two different malls in two different locations. If you prefer to stay close to KLCC but not in the city centre, Sunway Velocity has a hotel attached to the mall.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Malls in KL The Ultimate Family Shopping Experience

places.name: Sunway Velocity Mall

reviews.text:
If you're looking for a spacious, modern, and vibrant shopping mall in the heart of Kuala Lumpur, Sunway Velocity Mall won't disappoint. This urban lifestyle destination is not just a place to shop-it's a one-stop hub that brings together retail, food, and leisure in one dynamic location.

The mall is impressively well-organized, with clear signage and a bright, contemporary design that makes it easy to navigate. Whether you're hunting for fashion, electronics, groceries, or daily essentials, you'll find everything under one roof. From international brands to local favourites, the variety is excellent.

One of the highlights is the Food Street, which offers a diverse, flavour-packed range of meals and snacks-from Malaysian hawker-style delights to trendy cafes and international cuisines. It's the kind of place where you can grab a quick bite or linger over a cozy dinner with friends.

Families will appreciate the family-friendly atmosphere, with kid-friendly amenities and occasional pop-up events. It's also a great place to chill on weekends, with a cinema, lifestyle outlets, and plenty of Instagrammable corners.

In short, Sunway Velocity Mall is convenient, bustling, and complete-perfect for errands, catch-ups, or simply to enjoy a day out in a well-curated shopping environment.

I'm a truck a driver who often delivers  to this mall...it's so disappointing about the parking ...there is only 1 way to enter into the parking and if you missed it you have to go a big round and go through traffic jam to make a U turn to get into loading bay...and it's so difficult to exit the parking as they have changed 1 way for loading bay...and you only allocate 15 minutes free for us to deliver goods to your mall? Come on la...to get a bay itself will take so much time...even sometimes just for within 5 cartons I have to pay rm3 ...and again come on la we are delivering to your mall outlets...you should give us free parking or reduce the parking fee or at least give us minimum 30 minutes free parking...rm3 even on weekdays for us is too much...sometimes I had to rush like hell from not paying the rm3... rm3 matters to us...I'm saying this behalf of delivery drivers, e hailing/taxi drivers and also food delivery drivers...consider a little...it's acceptable if we are here for shopping...thank you.

The service at Haidilao is absolutely amazing! The staff are incredibly attentive, friendly, and always go the extra mile to make sure you're comfortable.

From the moment we walked in until we left, we felt well taken care of. They even offered snacks and games while we waited. Truly one of the best dining experiences  highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: The Central Market, also known as Pasar Seni, is a significant cultural site in Kuala Lumpur. It has evolved from a traditional wet market into a vibrant destination that reflects Malaysia's diverse cultural influences. The market features distinct sections representing Malay, Indian, and Chinese heritage where visitors can find local products like souvenirs and arts and crafts. Additionally, the upper floor houses a food court offering local delicacies. Outside the market, visitors can enjoy street performances and musical shows.

sources.snippet: The Central Market of Kuala Lumpur is within easy walking distance of Chinatown, Masjid Jamek, the “River of Life” and Merdeka Square. Don’t let the name fool you, this isn’t the “main market” of KL rather it is an arty, restored and repurposed market selling all manners of souvenirs, batik crafts and Malaysian mementos. During the weekend the market spills out from its central hall and into the surrounding streets and there are plenty of good dining options available.
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Shopping - Our Guide to the Best Malls and Markets

sources.snippet: Built in the 1880s and with a rather grand art deco entrance painted in baby blue and white, Central Market in Chinatown has seen it all over the years. Likely the most visited attraction and popular thing to do in Chinatown, Central Market started life as a wet market but now has over 100 arts and crafts and souvenir stalls. It is also incredibly popular with cruise ship visitors (so if your trip coincides with a cruise ship docking in KL, good luck!)
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

sources.snippet: This Art Deco building in the centre of town started life in 1888 as a produce market; today, Central Market is a must-stop for visitors on the hunt for souvenirs. It’s packed with shops and stalls selling quintessentially Malaysian wares, and though there is a certain amount of tat, there are also gems to be found. Time your visit with the arrival of one of the weekend markets that bring in local artisans and businesses.
sources.shortName: The best places to go shopping in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: A little more risqué than Little India, the Chinese quarter is well worth a visit. Catch a train trip from central Kuala Lumpur for about AU$1.20 and end up at the Central Market, which sells a stunning array of handcrafted Malaysian goods for tourists. Sarongs, bags, clothes, and jewellery all abound, although (being designed for tourists) they are only slightly cheaper than at home.
sources.shortName: A Shopaholic's Guide to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Central Market, located in the heart of Kuala Lumpur, is a bustling and vibrant destination that showcases the rich cultural heritage of Malaysia. This iconic landmark is a haven for art enthusiasts, history buffs, and shopaholics alike. As you step into Central Market, you will be greeted by a myriad of stalls selling traditional handicrafts, exquisite artworks, and unique souvenirs.
sources.shortName: Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Across the road from Petaling Street, you’ll find Central Market, another great spot for souvenir-hunters. The Central Market used to be KL’s wet-market but was converted into an artisan’s centre in the eighties. It’s a great place to find beautiful wood carvings, batik prints, songket weaves, paintings, pewter and locally-made fashion accessories.
sources.shortName: Where to shop in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: It has now transformed into a bustling epicentre of local crafts, arts and culture (Photo: Instagram/@centralmarketkualalumpur(. Central Market now routinely hosts various cultural activities (Photo: Instagram/@centralmarketkualalumpur). Central Market began as a wet market back in 1888 (Photo: Central Market)
sources.shortName: 6 malls to visit in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: The Central Market of Kuala Lumpur is a popular retail center established in 1888 as a wet market. Art-deco in style, the market is known for its high-quality products sold at affordable prices. It is also a great place to gain a deeper understanding of the heritage and culture of the city.
sources.shortName: [2023 GUIDE] The Best Places to Go Shopping in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Central Market, more colloquially known as Pasar Seni, is a symbol of cultural icon. From humble beginnings as a wet market, it has come to mean Malaysian arts and handicrafts. It is an ideal place to buy unique handicrafts, batik, souvenirs, and antiques.
sources.shortName: Best Malls and Local Markets in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Central Market Kuala Lumpur is a historically significant building, with its iconic building in light blue exterior. It opens its door in 1888 as a wet market. While it has now become a popular shopping mall for tourists, shoppers, and art lovers.

sources.shortName: Top 10 Best & Cheap Shopping Malls In Kuala Lumpur

places.name: Central Market

reviews.text:
A Great Spot for Tourists and Culture Lovers!
Central Market KL is a fantastic place to explore if you're visiting Kuala Lumpur. It's clean, well-organized, air-conditioned and filled with unique shops selling local crafts, souvenirs, traditional clothes, artwork, and handmade items. It's a great spot to find gifts and support local artisans.
The building itself has a charming, heritage feel, and the atmosphere is relaxed compared to other busy markets. There are also food stalls and cafes nearby where you can enjoy local snacks or take a break.
If you're a tourist looking to experience Malaysia's culture and do a bit of shopping in a comfortable setting, Central Market is definitely worth a visit. Highly recommended!

Central Market is a long-standing cultural landmark in the heart of Kuala Lumpur, popular among both tourists and locals. It's especially suitable for those looking to explore Malaysian handicrafts, batik clothing, souvenirs, and other traditional items.

Inside, you'll find a variety of boutique-style stalls offering local textiles, hand-painted batik, artisan crafts, and accessories. The market has a food court area as well, where visitors can enjoy local Malaysian cuisine at reasonable prices, making it a convenient stop for both shopping and a quick meal.

However, aside from the shops and food court, there's not much else to explore. The market serves more as a heritage shopping destination rather than a comprehensive tourist attraction. It's well-maintained and air-conditioned, but relatively small in size compared to modern shopping malls.

This is a total heaven for those who are into crafts, snacks, painting, souvenirs purchase, food, and clothing! This place has a strong ambience of creativity and uniqueness, and one can easily spent at least half a day to shop around. There is also a food court to enjoy your meal, before starting yourshopping spree. Highly recommended for those going to KL. This is a must-visit!

places.address: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, 50050 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Sogo is a department store located in proximity to the iconic Menara Kuala Lumpur and Merdeka Square, making it a great day trip destination. It offers a wide range of budget-friendly options, has a large selection of clothing, accessories, and household items, and has a large food court, making it a great place to grab a snack while you shop.

places.name: SOGO Kuala Lumpur

reviews.text: Sogo is a multi-storey department store. Each floor has its own assortment, the first floor is dedicated to women's fashion, the second to men's fashion, and the third to children's fashion. The ground floor is mainly dedicated to global brands in the field of fashion and cosmetics.A separate floor is for Sport and Leisure, another for home accessories. On the last floor is the Sogo Food Garden. On the ground floor there is a supermarket and fast food.
Visited as wife want to experience the feeling to shop at a Sogo department store again. Many choices of F&B outlets. Many famous merchants labels sold here. Good to spend some times shopping.

It's a very pretty and deal filled mall, very well organized and clean. I really liked the fact that the music wasn't so loud and that every brand had its own stand with a very clean and big panel you could see from far (my eyesight is quite bad, and it was helpful)
I enjoyed the deals that were all over the mall especially the underwear and perfumes ones! Perfect for gifts. Would recommend if you're looking for deals to bring a big quantity of stuff with a good price

places.generalDescription: The Curve is a stylish shopping destination located in Petaling Jaya, offering three floors of diverse retail outlets featuring clothing, home goods, and more. In addition to its numerous shops, the mall also boasts a wide array of outdoor dining options and recreational activities. What sets The Curve apart from other malls is its weekly flea market and non-retail events that add an extra layer of excitement to the shopping experience.

sources.snippet: The Curve has a well-designed Kids Zone on the First Floor which comes with not one but two free play areas for young ones. Kids can climb on a colorful, ship-inspired structure with slides, or explore the indoor playground. Coin-operated rides are also available scattered around on the same floor, along with a baby care room and toy stores like Early Learning Center and Lego.
sources.shortName: Best Malls For Families In Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: In the Damansara suburb, there are several major shopping malls such as One Utama (another massive mall around the same size as the Megamall) and The Curve. In the swanky Bangsar suburb, there’s the Bangsar Shopping Centre (BSC) and the Bangsar Village (I & II). And Subang Jaya has its Subang Parade.
sources.shortName: Where to shop in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Owing to its weekly flea market, the Curve Mall is regarded as one of the most popular malls of Petaling Jaya. The weekly flea market houses affordable cult fashion apparels which attract several visitors to the market. This mall houses about 250 stores in addition to several outdoor dining options.
sources.shortName: 20 Malls in Malaysia (2024)

sources.snippet: Located at Mutiara Damansara, The Curve shopping mall is one of the popular shopping malls in KL. It may be located near the Golden Triangle in KL, with plenty of shopping choices, but the Curve Shopping Mall is still worth exploring. With over 250 shops, you will find something that you need.
sources.shortName: 5 Top Shopping Malls In Kl For A Unique Retail Therapy

sources.snippet: The Curve is neither the biggest nor the most popular mall in Kuala Lumpur. It is also located pretty far out of the city center. Still it is a nice place to visit.
sources.shortName: Top10 shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur | FAQ

places.name: The Curve

reviews.text:
The Curve shopping mall in Petaling Jaya, Malaysia, offers a unique and relaxed shopping experience. Unlike the bustling atmosphere of other malls, The Curve is spacious and open, providing a calm environment for shoppers. It features a variety of shops, from fashion to electronics, and a wide range of dining options, including local and international cuisines.

The mall also has a vibrant outdoor area known as “The Street,” where visitors can enjoy live music and outdoor dining. Families will appreciate the kid-friendly arcade and play areas. With its convenient location and ample parking, The Curve is a great destination for a leisurely day out.

Whether you're looking to shop, dine, or simply unwind, The Curve has something for everyone.

The Curve may not be a top-tier mall and isn't particularly crowded even on weekends, but it's very kid-friendly, offering numerous kids' clothing stores and play areas. Most of the restaurants are located in the open-air section on the ground floor, creating a relaxed dining atmosphere.

The Curve is connected by link bridges to Curve NX and IKEA, making it convenient to explore all three locations in one trip.

May 2025
Alamak, so quiet... and cold. but the outside of the building is hot. bid building but less shops, less visitor too, is that because of TRX?

places.generalDescription: Plaza Low Yat, located in Kuala Lumpur, is one of the city's oldest shopping centers and is known for its focus on electronic items such as mobile phones, cameras, and accessories. While it offers a wide range of options for tech enthusiasts, visitors should be cautious as some shops may sell duplicated gadgets.

sources.snippet: Billed as the biggest IT / technology mall in Malaysia, Plaza Low Yat is THE mall and shopping center to go in KL (& Bukit Bintang) for new electrical equipment or to find replacement phone chargers, power packs or any other traveller techy needs. All the big electrical brands are represented here from DJI (this is the best place in KL for drones) to HP, Acer and Lenevo plus mobile phone brands like Oppo. Plaza Low Fat also has a small food court in the basement plus fast food joints on the outer edges – so a great place to debug your BenQ before having banana leaf rice or a Jollibee
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

sources.snippet: Proudly advertising as Malaysia’s biggest IT lifestyle mall, Plaza Low Yat is a mecca for all things gaming or electronic. A cylindrical mall set over multiple stores, this mall had every kind of electronic imaginable (apart from the Amazon Kindle we were looking for!) from custom built computers, mobile phones, camera equipment and enough selfie sticks to photograph the Red Army. If you did find yourself in Malaysia and needed a new graphics card, or more likely a specific camera part or USB cable, Plaza Low Yat would be a great place to head to.

sources.snippet: Low Yat Plaza is the technology and electronics haven of Kuala Lumpur. As locals know well Plaza Low Yat is actually the biggest digital lifestyle mall in Malaysia. In this digital lifestyle shopping mall you can find countless electronics, camera, gaming and IT stores, which makes it an excellent place to get a few vacation items, like a proper camera, a music player or a budget phone.

You won’t find the typical clothing boutiques or novelty stationery shops here. The 7-storey shopping mall, which recently underwent a makeover, is a tech paradise.

places.generalDescription: The Exchange TRX, also known as Tun Razak Exchange, is an up-and-coming financial district and lifestyle center that is set to transform the Kuala Lumpur skyline. At its heart will be the impressive Exchange 106 tower, which is poised to become one of the tallest structures in the area. This new development promises a fusion of high-end retail outlets, top-tier office spaces, and luxurious residential accommodations.

sources.snippet: A mid-week opening in November of 2023 did nothing to stop shoppers from swarming The Exchange TRX, the city’s sparkling new shopping complex commanding over 1,300,000 square feet. If 400 of the world's leading brands and retailers — including Malaysia’s first Apple Store, Malaysia’s first Shake Shack, and the Korean cult eyewear brand Gentle Monster’s first flagship store in the country — aren’t enough of a draw, the mall also has a ten-acre rooftop park featuring al fresco eateries, a play space with water play for kids, multi-purpose facilities, a formal garden, and an urban forest of more than 900 trees. A few other new-to-Malaysia brick-and-mortar brands currently exclusive to The Exchange TRX: the A-lister approved activewear brand Alo Yoga, cult-favourite skincare brand Drunk Elephant, and Maison Kitsuné and its café, roastery and resto-bar, Café Kitsuné.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in KL

sources.snippet: Exchange TRX, which only opened its doors on November 29, 2023, adds a fresh dynamic to Kuala Lumpur’s retail landscape. Although many of its shops were not yet operational when we visited the mall in December, this mall is already making a mark with its free outdoor playground, offering a delightful space for family fun. The playground’s presence amidst the evolving shopping environment makes Exchange TRX a promising destination for families seeking a blend of retail therapy and outdoor enjoyment once the majority of the shops and restaurants finally open.
sources.shortName: Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur for Families

sources.snippet: Kuala Lumpur’s newest shopping centre as of April 2025, The Exchange TRX shopping mall opened to great fanfare in December 2023 and is one of Kuala Lumpur’s best luxury malls. Just a 5 minute walk downhill from the Pavilion area of Bukit Bintang, we visited The Exchange TRX during its opening week and it was absolutely buzzing – the Exchange TRX food court in particular was rammed. As well as luxury brands like Gucci, Prada and Louis Vuitton, The Exchange TRX also has international big brand stores like Uniqlo, Ecco and Footlocker.
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

sources.snippet: The Exchange TRX is KL’s latest upscale mall which has been abuzz with shoppers ever since it opened its doors in 2023. It introduced a whole slew of notable international brands making their debuts in Malaysia, including Japan’s Seibu, Korea’s Gentle Monster, and New York’s Shake Shack. The mall is home to the first Apple Store in the country too – it’s an unmissable 3-storey store with a ‘Grammable pyramid-shaped roof.

places.name: The Exchange TRX

reviews.text:
The TRX – the Tun Razak Exchange is one of the latest and most exciting shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur. It's a brand new addition to the city's ever-growing list of modern lifestyle destinations. Located right in the heart of KL, TRX offers a fresh shopping experience with a stylish design, vibrant atmosphere, and a wide range of local and international brands. One of the biggest highlights is the official Apple Store – and not just any store, it's the only one in the whole of Malaysia! That alone makes it a huge attraction for tech lovers and Apple fans.

The mall is also surrounded by lush greenery and a rooftop park, creating a unique mix of nature and urban lifestyle. It's the perfect place to hang out, relax, and explore. With everything from high-end fashion to delicious food spots, TRX truly brings something new and exciting to the KL shopping scene. Definitely a place to check out!  Its a nice place to hang out while at Kuala Lumpur either for business or holiday…

Super easy to get to, right on the MRT line. The mall is high end, modern, spacious, and full of great shops, from luxury brands to everyday stores. There's also an awesome rooftop park that's free to visit, perfect for chilling or catching sunset views. Plenty of food options too, from fancy restaurants to local favourites. Whether you're shopping, eating, or just hanging out, TRX Mall has it all. Definitely worth a visit!

Honestly, I've known about this place for quite some time. Been to KL before but never bothered to check it out. This time, I had to because my wife wanted to see the mall. Surprisingly, it's actually really nice! Lots of brands, and the layout, environment, and design are well done. It's still just another mall, but honestly, a lot nicer than many others around. Wife managed to buy her lipstick too 😂

Just a heads up though, parking's not cheap, and can be a bit confusing. The food court gets super packed during peak hours. And some parts of the mall still feel slightly unfinished. But overall, still worth checking out.

places.address: Persiaran TRX, Tun Razak Exchange, 55188 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: IOI Mall Puchong is a vast retail destination showcasing an array of chain department stores, boutiques and dining options on two floors. The mall also boasts a cinema for entertainment purposes. With the Chinese New Year around the corner, the mall has geared up to host diverse cultural performances and activities such as Acrobatic Lion Dance, LED Dragon Dance, Diabolo, Face Mask Changing and 5 Majestic Drum to celebrate the festivities in style.

sources.snippet: Since its opening in 1996, IOI Mall has been one of the locals’ favourite places to go during the weekends. I remember longing to visit the mall when I was a kid, just to get a ride on its iconic, magical carousel that was bought from the United States. IOI Mall Puchong features two buildings, Old Wing and New Wing, and there are approximately 250 stores.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Kuala Lumpur Shopping Malls for Avid Shopaholics

places.name: IOI Mall Puchong

reviews.text:
IOI Mall Puchong may not be the flashiest or most luxurious mall in the Klang Valley, but it holds a firm place in the heart of the local community. Strategically located right along the LDP Highway and directly connected to the IOI Puchong Jaya LRT station, this mall is one of the easiest to access - whether you're driving or taking public transport. For many Puchong folks, this is the go-to mall for daily shopping, dining, or just spending a laid-back afternoon.

Accessibility & Convenience
The convenience of getting here is a big plus. If you're coming by LRT, there's a covered pedestrian link bridge that connects directly from the IOI Puchong Jaya station to the mall. For those who drive, parking is quite manageable with both outdoor and multi-level parking bays. The location along the LDP makes it very visible and accessible for residents in Puchong, Bandar Kinrara, and even Subang or Sunway.

Retail & Shopping
While you won't find high-end luxury brands here, the mall does cover a wide range of retail needs. There's a good mix of mid-range fashion outlets, sporting goods, accessories, electronics, mobile phone shops, and bookstores. The AEON department store and supermarket is a popular anchor tenant, offering everything from groceries and daily essentials to household items and clothing.

What stands out in IOI Mall is the dedicated IT section - a whole area filled with computer shops, phone accessory vendors, repair kiosks, and tech gadget stores. Whether you're looking for a new laptop, computer parts, a printer, or just getting your phone fixed, this IT zone is quite comprehensive and convenient.

Food & Beverage Heaven
One of the biggest reasons people love coming here is the food. IOI Mall has no shortage of dining options, catering to all budgets and cravings. There are more than three steamboat and BBQ restaurants inside or adjacent to the mall - including hotpot chains and Korean BBQ options. It's a great spot if you're craving something hearty and want to enjoy a group meal.

Beyond that, the mall also hosts a Food Street-style zone offering local Malaysian dishes, snacks, and desserts. You'll also find well-known fast food outlets like McDonald's, KFC, Texas Chicken, Subway, and more.

If you're into coffee and drinks, IOI Mall has an impressive lineup of beverage brands. From big international names like Starbucks and The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf, to local favourites like ZUS Coffee, Daily Coffee, HWC, and Chagee, there's no shortage of caffeine and bubble tea options. Whether you're looking for a quiet café to work from or just grabbing a quick drink, the choices are solid and spread across the mall.

Entertainment & Atmosphere
The mall has a TGV Cinema that screens all the latest blockbusters, plus a family-friendly environment with arcades and children's play areas. On weekends, you'll see pop-up booths, exhibitions, or local craft markets at the central concourse.

The atmosphere here is more casual and community-focused than upscale. It may not have the modern polish of malls like Pavilion or The Exchange TRX, but it's comfortable, clean, and functional. Some parts of the mall are older, but general maintenance is decent. Escalators and restrooms are usually in good working condition, and the mall is air-conditioned throughout.

Final Thoughts
IOI Mall Puchong is what you might call a “local hero” - a mall that may not try to be everything for everyone, but gets the basics right. It's practical, accessible, and offers a well-rounded mix of shopping, food, entertainment, and services. The added convenience of the LRT station, tech and IT zone, plus the growing number of trendy drink spots and steamboat restaurants, makes it very relevant even as newer malls pop up around the Klang Valley.

Whether you're here for groceries, grabbing dinner, catching a movie, or just sipping coffee with a friend, IOI Mall provides a reliable and familiar space - one that continues to evolve without losing its neighborhood charm.

Visited for a plant sale. Watsons too. Basement parking doesn't have bay occupancy lights and can be dark in areas. The mall air-conditioning can also be quite cold in areas. Relatively low footfall compared to other larger malls but still a decent sized crowd. Some unique shops here. E.g. signature market. Toilets are modern and clean.

A lot of exquisite food and beverage outlets , watches , fashion , sport wears , mobile gadgets , confectioneries , bakeries , bookshop and a grand theatre etc . All are vibrant and impactful granting you unique shopping experiences .

places.generalDescription: Sunway Putra Mall is a modern shopping destination located in the bustling central business district of Kuala Lumpur. places.name: The Mines Shopping Mall

reviews.text: Mines Mall, located in Selangor, Malaysia, is a well-established shopping destination known for its unique blend of retail, dining, and leisure options. The mall is spacious, offering a variety of local and international brands, making it a great spot for shopping. Its central atrium is often the focal point, hosting events and exhibitions. The dining options range from casual eateries to more upscale restaurants.

Went to the newly opened indoor playground  named KinZo located at The Mines Shopping Mall South Court- L4. It's slightly bigger than the existing one (Taurus & Bunny) as it offers indoor gokart as well (different price). The entrance fees are reasonable on weekdays but quite expensive on weekend/PH considering the place is not too big for the kids to explore. Other than that, it lacks facilities like toilets and baby rooms. However the staffs are helpful and kind, the place is clean too. Overall, recommended for families to have fun and enjoy their time together.

The Mines Shopping Mall has been operating for over 30 years and is still a relevant and worthwhile place to visit. One of its unique attractions is the indoor cruise ride-definitely something you don't see in every mall! With four levels of shops, you'll find a mix of fashion, lifestyle, and services, plus a food court on the Ground Floor offering a good variety of food options. Parking is also convenient and reasonably priced.

However, there's room for improvement. At times, the mall gives off a bit of an old-school or heritage feel, especially with some lesser-known outlets. It would be great if the management could bring in more well-known brands to refresh the mall and attract more visitors.

Still, it remains a charming and relaxing spot-especially if you're looking for something different from the typical mall experience.

sources.shortName: Top10 shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur | FAQ

places.name: Fahrenheit88

reviews.text:
Fahrenheit88 is a vibrant shopping destination located in the heart of Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur. Its central location makes it an accessible and convenient spot for both locals and tourists seeking a unique shopping and entertainment experience.

The mall offers a diverse mix of stores, including trendy fashion boutiques, specialty shops, and lifestyle outlets, catering to a variety of tastes and budgets. Whether you're looking for clothing, beauty products, or tech gadgets, there's something here for everyone. It's also home to the popular Uniqlo flagship store, which is a must-visit for quality and affordable apparel.

Fahrenheit88 stands out for its focus on local and independent brands, providing a platform for up-and-coming designers and entrepreneurs. This makes it a great place to find unique and creative products that you won't easily find elsewhere.

The dining options are varied, from casual cafes to international cuisine, perfect for a quick bite or a leisurely meal. The mall also hosts fun events and seasonal decorations, adding to its lively atmosphere.

While it may not be as grand as some neighboring malls like Pavilion KL, Fahrenheit88 offers a more relaxed and intimate shopping experience. If you're in Bukit Bintang, it's definitely worth a visit for its distinct charm and diverse offerings! 🛍️✨

A nice mall with a good mix of stores. Very clean and well laid out. There is an information desk in the middle of the first floor with friendly staff to assist you. On the second floor is a DIY store with a large selection of useful products at great prices. I bought some knee braces for 80% less than the sports store. Upstairs is a cinema.

I've visited this mall several times because it's located in Bukit Bintang, which is a popular and busy area. The mall itself is clean, modern, and generally has a nice environment with friendly staff and a good crowd. However, there are a few things I noticed that I think really need improvement.

First of all, I was surprised to see that there isn't a supermarket or grocery store inside the mall. For a place in such a prime location with so many visitors, it's honestly disappointing. Many people – including tourists, families, and locals – often look for a place to grab essentials or do quick grocery shopping after dining or walking around. Not having that option makes the mall feel incomplete.

Another thing is the baby room. While I appreciate that there is one, it's really small and doesn't have hot or warm water, which is important for families with babies. If you're a parent and need to prepare milk or clean up, it's not very convenient. I really hope they consider upgrading this facility to better support family visitors.

I like this mall and see its potential, but these small things make a big difference. A grocery store and better family-friendly facilities would make the mall much more useful and complete for everyday needs.

places.address: 179, Jln Gading, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Sungei Wang Plaza, also known as the 'River of Gold', has been a prominent shopping destination in Bukit Bintang since 1977. sources.snippet: Sungei Wang Plaza has been around for more than two decades and can be considered as one of the oldest institutions in the Bukit Bintang area and is still attracting crowds of visitors!. Sungei Wang Plaza houses more than 500 retail outlets selling everything from food to clothes, with the topmost floor dedicated to fashion for youth from a variety of home-grown labels (you can thank us later, people!). The homegrown labels such as charmz, concetto, J&Q, Mechadioz Omocha & Design are very popular among students and young girls or boys who are on budgets as they tend to provide trendy clothes, shoes, books, cosmetics at an affordable price (a win-win situation for all!).
