sources.snippet: For some affordable and exclusive shopping therapy, you can visit the Sungei Wang Plaza, one of the best featured places on the KL shopping mall list. Opened in the year 1979, the plaza is built on an area of 1.2 million sq. ft with the best retail outlets.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Malls In Kuala Lumpur Every Shopper Should Visit

sources.snippet: Sungei Wang Plaza is one of the oldest shopping malls in the Bukit Bintang area. It has been around for decades and is still attracting plenty of visitors. It comprises more than 500 retail outlets, selling various items ranging from food to clothes.
sources.shortName: [2023 GUIDE] The Best Places to Go Shopping in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: We were serious when we said ‘Every kilometre you turn, there’s a mall in KL’. Just a few hundred metres from Lot 10 is Sungei Wang Plaza. This is one of the more budget-friendly shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur and is popular among locals.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Malls in KL The Ultimate Family Shopping Experience

sources.snippet: Attached to this is BB Plaza – you can only tell you’re in a different complex when the lino on the floor changes. This is full of kitschy clothes and toys, and is also where my favourite hole-in-the-wall beauty salon is found.
sources.shortName: Best shopping in Kuala Lumpur

places.name: Sungei Wang Plaza

reviews.text: Sungei Wang Plaza was the first mall I visited in Kuala Lumpur. It's located in a very busy area of the city and has a bit of everything:mainly small shops, local restaurants, and a supermarket with plenty of Malaysian food items, great for souvenirs. Worth a visit.

A simple mall made up of majority clothing/fashion stores, restaurants, a decent sized food court on the top floor, and more. It's not in my opinion a super exciting/interesting mall as it's on the simpler side yet if you're looking to buy clothing, shoes, accessories, etc, you'll probably really like this mall.

Plaza Sungei Wang is more of a market-style shopping centre rather than a high-end mall. Lots of small shops, budget fashion, tech accessories, and a big focus on gaming culture. We noticed what looked like a gaming tournament or e-sports event happening while we were there, which might be exciting if you're into that scene.

That said, it wasn't really our style of shopping – quite busy, a bit older in feel, and more geared toward niche hobbies or bargain hunting than mainstream retail.

✅ Worth checking out if you're into gaming, cosplay, or retro gadgets – otherwise, there are more modern malls nearby like Pavilion or Lot 10.

📍Good central location in Bukit Bintang, with easy access from the monorail.

places.address: Jln Sultan Ismail, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: NU Sentral Shopping Mall is a bustling multi-level shopping complex located in the heart of Kuala Lumpur. It serves as a central transportation hub, with several metro lines and the monorail connecting to the new KL Sentral railway station. The mall is surrounded by high rises and offers convenient access to various modes of transportation. Visitors can explore its diverse range of shops, restaurants, and entertainment options.

sources.snippet: A slick, shiny and very popular Kuala Lumpur mall (as it is right next to the KL Sentral transport hub), NU Sentral is a metropolis of merchandise. Popular international brands at NU Sentral include a Marks and Spencers food hall (British biscuits and nice things) and a Mini So, plus a Malaysia Air travel shop. We also really like the Quizinn food court as it is so cheap (and the Indian food stall is great, maybe because it is so close to Brickfields)
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

sources.snippet: NU Sentral may not be the biggest mall in KL, but it’s certainly the tallest and one of the easiest malls to reach, no matter where you are in Malaysia. The mall has 9 levels and is directly linked to KL Sentral, the city’s main transit hub that connects intercity and interstate trains, and passenger train lines. The shops here cover everything – well-known eateries and apparel shops, hair salons, banks, florists, nail parlours, gyms, and more.
sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal Malaysia - Travel, Lifestyle, Culture & Language Guide
sources.shortName: 14 Best Shopping Malls In Kuala Lumpur For Retail Therapy

sources.snippet: Nu Sentral : Nestled in the heart of Kuala Lumpur, Nu Sentral offers urbanites a vibrant shopping experience. This modern mall houses a mix of popular brands, speciality stores, and a variety of dining options. With its strategic location and convenient access to public transportation, Nu Sentral is a go-to destination for those seeking retail therapy in the city.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Shopping Malls In KL & Selangor – Things to do in KL

sources.snippet: Located next to KL Sentral, the transportation hub of KL, this strategic location makes it easy for those who travel by public transport. You can have a quick shop if you still have some time waiting for the next train. It may not have as much choice as the other larger malls in the city, but it still has a well-curated selection of stores for you to shop.
sources.shortName: 5 Top Shopping Malls In Kl For A Unique Retail Therapy

sources.snippet: The eight storied Nu Sentral shopping mall is linked with the KL Sentral which is the central hub of the vast railway network in Kuala Lumpur. The huge array of stores houses several mid-range outlets retailing top western and Asian brands galore. There are ample opportunities for entertainment, dining and shopping alike.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

sources.snippet: NU Sentral Shopping Mall KL is one of the trendy and cheap shopping malls in KL that caters to the needs of urbanites, commuters, and tourists alike. Besides it is conveniently situated adjacent to the KL Sentral Station. With offers a seamless connection between public transportation and a vibrant shopping experience.
sources.siteName: Private Car Hire Transport | Limo Taxi From Singapore To Malaysia
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best & Cheap Shopping Malls In Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: NU Sentral is the shopping mall linked to KL Sentral, the transport hub of Kuala Lumpur. KL Sentral serves as a transit hub for all forms of public transportation. Every rail line is housed there, including the Putra LRT, Star LRT, KTM Komuter, KTM Intercity, KLIA Transit, and KLIA Express.
sources.shortName: Top ten shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur- An Ultimate Guide

places.name: NU Sentral

reviews.text: Always happy to visit this mall, because of the convenience of KL Sentral. The mall is huge and serves all walks of life, especially travellers. Great shopping and food choices, too. Recommended.

The mall is in a very convenient location near KL Sentral station. The shops here are rather limited in choice but there are a wide variety of restaurants for dining. A very nice spot for travellers to spend some time.

The first mall that i go through when I arrived in KL sentral. went here to buy Touch and Go Card.

Nice foodcourt where I have my late lunch as Im hungry after the flight. Just go here if you're waiting for your travel starting from KL Sentral

places.address: 201, Jalan Tun Sambanthan, Kuala Lumpur Sentral, 50470 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Avenue K Shopping Mall is a major shopping center located opposite the famous Suria KLCC in Kuala Lumpur. While not as grand as its neighbor, it offers a wide range of local and international brands, along with entertainment options like Breakout escape room, Karaoke Manekineko, and SUPERPARK Malaysia. The mall provides an experiential journey with a rooftop venue and plenty of Instagrammable spaces for shoppers to explore.

sources.snippet: Many tend to miss out on Avenue K, a KL shopping mall located right opposite the famous Suria KLCC. Although it is not as grand and massive as Suria KLCC, Avenue K offers a wide range of local and international brands, as well as a lot of fun activities you can participate in. There are multiple entertainment options here: Breakout, an escape room with various themes; Karaoke Manekineko, one of Japan’s biggest karaoke chains; and SUPERPARK Malaysia, a family-friendly, all-inclusive indoor activity park. Having been to all of the entertainment venues here, I would say that it is worth every penny, and I definitely feel like coming back again.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Kuala Lumpur Shopping Malls for Avid Shopaholics

sources.snippet: A small but smart shopping centre just across the road from Petronas Towers and KLCC Suria, Avenue K mall is a tiny but trendy boutique mall that has lots of big brands like H&M, Leica, Sephora and Cotton On plus oodles of restaurants. On the second floor of Avenue K, there is a dedicated food court called Food City (formerly Taste Enclave) which has around 15 different food stalls and kiosks. Avenue Kopening hours: 10am to 10pm daily
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

sources.snippet: Shopping at Avenue K is akin to a journey of discovery that captivates the senses. Embark on a retail adventure with exciting experiences waiting to be uncovered!. The mall is teeming with inspirational possibilities as it has a phenomenal rooftop venue and a profusion of Instagrammable spaces – Avenue K is an experiential destination that has transformed the art of shopping.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia

sources.snippet: Avenue K sits in a prime location facing the iconic Petronas Twin Towers. It’s a nice shopping destination with good shops, ranging from worldwide to local. Their food and beverage are good as well, with fast food choices to fine dining options.
sources.shortName: Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur for Families

sources.snippet: Located at the center of KLCC and connected with Suria through a tunnel. It has a newly opened branch of Super Park Malaysia a very spacious indoor park for kids. Kids of all ages can enjoy this place.
sources.shortName: Best Kids Friendly shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur – Phirlo – Travel Tales & Reviews

places.name: Avenue K Shopping Mall

reviews.text: Avenue K isn't just a mall-it's a vertical escape tucked into the city's rhythm. With its soaring atrium and curving escalators, it feels like stepping into a quiet, modern amphitheatre of shopping, food, and light. The atmosphere is calm but alive, a rare mix in the middle of bustling KL. You'll find familiar brands alongside indie surprises, with clean walkways and helpful staff that make wandering feel intentional. And unlike flashier malls, Avenue K doesn't scream for attention-it draws you in with quiet confidence and thoughtful design. A polished, underrated gem for urban explorers and window shoppers alike.

A seemingly fairly new mall almost opposite the Petronas Tower. The main entrance is large and you enter directly into a large and bright room. The mall is on several floors and on the bottom floor faces the KLCC metro station. The bottom two floors are mostly fast food shops (some kind of food court). Most of the restaurants are on the top floor. There were not many people when I visited the mall.

I visited the top level of this mall recently. It is nice with a rooftop vibe and outdoor area, which includes a fountain. A number of restaurants have opened here and more to come judging by the sinages. This venue allows for dining al fresco style with a great view of the KLCC twin towers. This mall has a multi-level basement car park and also an LRT station, so transportation and parking are not an issue.

places.address: 156, Jln Ampang, Kuala Lumpur City Centre, 50450 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Publika Shopping Gallery is a modern shopping destination located in Solaris Dutamas, Sri Hartamas, Kuala Lumpur. It's a popular spot for avid shoppers, offering a variety of boutiques, restaurants, galleries, and even a supermarket. The mall's interior features an impressive steel and glass art piece that adds to its contemporary ambiance. Additionally, it has a futuristic and avant-garde playground for kids with basic activities.

sources.snippet: Publika Shopping Gallery is a creative hub that captivates both adults and children alike, with an open-air piazza and an outdoor park. It’s not simply a shopping destination, but a space for community, arts and cultural events, and markets, making it a lively spot all-year round. Between shopping sprees at specialty stores peddling local designs, home décor and vintage collectibles, the mall is also famous for its food offerings from Positano Risto’s contemporary Italian cuisine to Chica Bonita’s tacos and tequilas, plus bars with live music, izakayas, and even mamak stalls.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in KL

sources.snippet: You can’t go wrong with choosing any place among our offered collection but Publika Mall has its own unique allure, not to mention that it’s regarded as one of the best Kuala Lumpur malls where you can find clothing stores as well as a supermarket which contains all your grocery needs. And if you want to loosen up a little in this mall, which is considered one of the best Kuala Lumpur shopping centers, there’s also the possibility to swing by Positano Restaurant or Starbucks Coffee ..
sources.shortName: The 10 best shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Publika is a mall that features a wide range of stores that sell handmade and artisanal products. Publika also has a large selection of restaurants and cafes that offer a variety of cuisines. Publika Shopping Gallery, as the name suggests is more of a shopping gallery than a shopping mall.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Malls in KL The Ultimate Family Shopping Experience

places.name: Publika Shopping Gallery

reviews.text:
Good shopping and dining options.
Loved the idea of the open booth for family businesses.
Highly recommend visiting, especially during holiday season.
Mall has an outdoor sitting area as well.
High end, small but trendy mall. Good selection of costumes for Eid ul Fitr. Parking is inconvenient. Close to KL.

A mall with nice restaurant & cafe options. Unfortunately, not friendly for cyclists. Travelled here with our bikes - there are no bike parkings, and guards aren't happy for us to leave our bikes even if we're sitting next to it - having our brunch at the cafe.

places.address: 1, Jln Dutamas 1, Solaris Dutamas, 50480 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Spacious shopping mall featuring a grocery store, various retailers & a food court with many stalls.

sources.snippet: Next door to Sunway Velocity Mall, this Kuala Lumpur mall is a little out of the city in between the Pudu and Pandan Perdana neighbourhoods. A well loved local mall in Kuala Lumpur, AEON Mall Taman Maluri has mainly independent shops plus fast food outlets like Nandos and KFC. AEON Mall opening hours: 10am – 10pm (Monday to Friday) / 10am – 10:30pm (Saturday and Sundays)
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

places.name: ÆON Mall Taman Maluri

reviews.text: Shopping at AEON Maluri offers a convenient and enjoyable experience for visitors seeking a wide range of products under one roof. The mall features a well-organized layout with diverse stores, including fashion, electronics, groceries, and specialty shops, catering to various customer needs. The supermarket is particularly well-stocked, offering fresh produce and household essentials at competitive prices. Dining options are plentiful, ranging from local cuisine to international fast-food chains, ensuring something for every palate. The mall is clean, family-friendly, and easily accessible via public transport or ample parking facilities. However, during peak hours, it can get crowded, and waiting times at some stores or restaurants may increase. Overall, AEON Maluri is a reliable shopping destination with a balanced mix of affordability and variety.

A convenient Aeon mall which is located in Taman Maluri Cheras one of the busiest area. If you want to spend your day buying clothes and eating in a nice restaurants, the Aeon mall is the place for you. I have been here few times. If you're planning to buy clothes for your babies this is the place for you plenty of choices compare to other Aeons. I had a good experience during my last visit 17th March 2025 around 3pm until 5pm the cashier who attended me is very respectful and with a smile his name Mr Amir Iman kids dept I saw his name tag you can spot him in my pic I posted. Good service and happy customer but I disappointed with the info counter staff when I reach him to find a food stall Mr Pan Mee the male staff in the counter said go to the supermarket can find there and I went all the way to find but I couldn't find then I asked the opposite stall staff she said it's permanently closed it's bad to know the info counter is not updated. Otherwise all good. You may reach out their TikTok page (Aeon Taman Maluri) for the current updates. It's very easy for customers. Thank you

If you're hunting for affordable yet thoughtful fresh flowers, AEON's flower section actually surprised me 🌸. You can get a single wrapped rose for only RM 15.94 🌹 or go for a more elegant one-rose bouquet with fillers for RM 25.88 - perfect if you want to keep it sweet but special 💐. I ended up customizing a bouquet with 3 roses and some baby's breath for around RM 56 💕 - way cheaper than online florist platforms.

What I liked:

1. Can tailor ribbon + wrapping paper your bouquet on the spot ✂️🎀
2. Prices clearly labelled - no surprise costs 🏷️
3. Good selection even inside a supermarket 🛒
4. Staff nearby if you want to add ribbons or wrap upgrades 🎁

places.address: Jalan Jejaka, Maluri, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Lot 10 is a vibrant 5-story shopping mall located in the heart of Kuala Lumpur's main shopping and entertainment district. Recently renovated, it now features ISETAN, The Japan Store, offering an authentic Japanese experience with a wide range of goods imported from Japan. Visitors can explore local boutiques, concept stores, and international brands while enjoying the diverse dining options at Lot 10 Hutong Foodcourt.

sources.snippet: Make sure to swing by Lot 10 Shopping Mall which is the best mall in Kuala Lumpur and discover its numerous areas that are filled with a number of great clothing stores and shoe stores, and additionally, there’s also a supermarket that allows you possibility to get all of your daily needs. Furthermore, in this mall, which is considered one of the best Kuala Lumpur shopping centers, we also highly advise you to try out The Table Restaurant which offers tasty dishes, or Molten Chocolate Cafe that’s ideal for spending an enjoyable time with friends ..
sources.shortName: The 10 best shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Lot 10 Mall is home to well known brands like H&M, Isetan Japanese supermarket and the Don Don Donki Japanese discount store. The main entrance by Bukit Bintang MRT station has numerous food carts and food stalls including KL’s biggest ice-cream stall (a variation on Taiwan’s tall ice-cream cones). We discovered on our most recent Kuala Lumpur stay in Bukit Bintang that the Lot 10 Mall has a rooftop area with views of Bukit Bintang plus a restaurant and a huge church.
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

sources.snippet: When it comes to finding legit Japanese food in KL that’ll even impress your Japanese friends, there’s no better place to visit than Lot 10 – more specifically, J’s Gate Dining. The dining hall brings together over 15 Japanese eateries on the 4th floor of the mall. Be satisfied by all sorts of authentic Japanese food, from BBQ beef don and udon noodles to artisan crepes and warabimochi.
sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal Malaysia - Travel, Lifestyle, Culture & Language Guide
sources.shortName: 14 Best Shopping Malls In Kuala Lumpur For Retail Therapy

sources.snippet: A very short walk from Pavilion Mall (literally opposite the entrance/exit to Bukit Bintang station) is Lot 10. This relatively small shopping centre (for Kuala Lumpur) seemed to mainly consist of a large H&M store and the delightfully named Japanese shop Don Don Donki. For those who haven’t experienced this Japanese institution, it's worth getting lost in its bizarre aisles.
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Shopping - Our Guide to the Best Malls and Markets

sources.snippet: For nearly three decades, Lot 10 has been one of the most iconic shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur. It is located along the bustling Bukit Bintang Street and houses some prominent tenants like H&M, Isetan, and Don Don Donki. Lot 10 consists of a total of six floors, with an open-air rooftop cafe at the top named Eden Cafe that features a view of the KL Tower.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Kuala Lumpur Shopping Malls for Avid Shopaholics

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for more shopping options beyond Pavilion, a short 6-minute walk along Bintang Walk will bring you to Lot 10 in Bukit Bintang. In our honest opinion, Lot 10 is worth visiting more for the food options than the mall itself. The stores and food court in Lot 10 mall are relatively quiet compared to the two larger malls mentioned above.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Malls in KL The Ultimate Family Shopping Experience

sources.snippet: In the Bukit Bintang area, you have a variety of malls such as the high-end Starhill, the mid-end Lot 10 and the wonderfully chaotic Sungei Wang Plaza (great bargains here for electronics, jewellery, watches and clothes). Not far from Sungei Wang, there’s another massive mall: Berjaya Time Square.
sources.shortName: Where to shop in Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Lot 10 has been there for almost 30 years and is one of the first large-scale shopping malls established in Kuala Lumpur. The main attraction here is the first Isestan store opened outside Japan. There is also a Japanese store where you can get almost any Japanese food and cooking ingredients.
sources.shortName: Top ten shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur- An Ultimate Guide

sources.snippet: A short walk from Jalan Bukit Bintang and another fantastic option for food enthusiasts is  Lot 10 Shopping Centre!. They have a fantastic food court, which is great if you and your family want to enjoy different cuisines. If you’re a fan of Japanese food, this is where you want to be!
sources.shortName: Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur for Families

sources.snippet: Lot10 is perhaps the most centrally located mall in Kuala Lumpur, right along Jalan Bukit Bintang. It has quite a few nice shops and also a National Geographer Flagship Store. In the basement you can find Hutong, a wonderful food court with mainly Chinese hawkers.
sources.shortName: Top10 shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur | FAQ

sources.snippet: Nestled in the heart of the city, Lot 10 is the focal point for locals and tourists to meet.play.#lovelot10. The dynamic and fashion-forward destination offer a trendy environment that entertains, excites and engages shoppers.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia

sources.snippet: You’ll also find quality golf gear in department store Isetan over at Lot 10, and plenty of places in between to eat satays on the run or dine in for a full Malay meal.
sources.shortName: Best shopping in Kuala Lumpur

places.name: Lot 10

reviews.text: I really like how they have renovated this place and give it a nice modern look. Many shops are Japanese theme and also large selection of Japanese food is available. The H&M is huge and Swee Lee music store is well stocked. The food court on the top floor has a very relaxing vibe

Shopping centre with a food court, restaurants and a quite variety of shops. HM, Don Donkey, Beryl's, Pierre Cardin lingerie, musical instruments and much more.
There is sone really nice restaurants that aren't to expensive.
There is also a Gaming Hall.
And the Food Court is pretty good

My wife and I were here today for a look-see. We last visited this shopping mall in 2017 - we are from Johor Bahru. Sadly, in our opinion, this shopping mall has aged a lot since, and the shops therein looked "tired and weary" - except maybe the Don Don Donki outlet and the H&M outlet. We were also quite disappointed that there is a 50 Sen charge for using the public toilets here. For us, the only place worth visiting here is Hutong 10 - our favourite food court in KL.

places.address: 50, Bukit Bintang Rd, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: LaLaport Bukit Bintang City Centre is the first of its kind in Southeast Asia, offering six floors of shopping space with a mix of local and international brands, including some exclusive Japanese labels not found elsewhere in Malaysia. This new addition to Kuala Lumpur's shopping scene opened its doors in January 2022 and features a unique white gateway that stands as a remnant of the historic Pudu Prison upon which the mall is built.

sources.snippet: Billed as a ‘Japanese lifestyle mall’, we actually rate LaLaport Bukit Bintang City Centre as one of the best malls in Kuala Lumpur as it is very new, doesn’t get that busy compared to say Pavilion shopping center and has lots of interesting shops (including a dedicated Japanese food court). Similar to the Exchange TRX, LaLaport Bukit Bintang City Centre has a nice rooftop garden plus a beautiful art deco style cinema ( GSC LaLaport BBCC) which many people say is the most Instagrammable cinema in Malaysia (very plush interiors). Whilst there, also check out the LED stairs and the excellent outdoor food street which has lots of super cheap lunchtime specials.
sources.shortName: Kuala Lumpur Malls - 23 Best Shopping Centres 2025

sources.snippet: Also owned by the Mitsui Fudosan Group like Mitsui Outlet Park, Lalaport is situated within the Bukit Bintang City Centre. Since its opening in 2022, this shopping mall in KL has received much attention for its Japanese-inspired concept and its unique and mesmerising architecture. It is also Southeast Asia’s first-ever Lalaport mall.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Kuala Lumpur Shopping Malls for Avid Shopaholics

sources.snippet: LaLaport Bukit Bintang City Centre is the latest addition to the long shopping mall lists in Kuala Lumpur. This new shopping center opened its door in January 2022. The distinctive white gateway, which will undoubtedly become an Instagram classic, is the last remaining piece of the destroyed Pudu Prison, over which the mall is built.
sources.shortName: Top ten shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur- An Ultimate Guide

sources.snippet: One of the latest shopping malls in KL, LaLaport is a must-visit place. Owned by the Mitsui Fudosan Group, this shopping mall has many Japanese stalls and restaurants you won’t see at other shopping malls in KL. The first thing that attracts you will be the staircase Grand Steps.
sources.shortName: 5 Top Shopping Malls In Kl For A Unique Retail Therapy

places.name: LaLaport Bukit Bintang City Centre

reviews.text: Visiting LalaPort Mall was an enjoyable and convenient experience. The mall has a modern and spacious layout that makes it easy to navigate, even on a busy day. One of the first things I appreciated was the variety of shops. Ranging from international brands to local favorites, which gave me plenty of options for both shopping and browsing. The food court was another highlight, offering a mix of Japanese, Asian, and Western cuisine. It was clean, well-organized, and had enough seating even during peak hours. I especially liked the presence of some niche eateries that are hard to find in other malls. What stood out to me the most was the attention to design and atmosphere. The interiors were aesthetically pleasing and there was a calm, relaxed vibe throughout. It didn't feel overly commercial or rushed, which made the experience more pleasant. I also noticed that the facilities were well-maintained. Restrooms were clean and there were plenty of places to rest or wait comfortably.

A huge and sophisticated mall with many big brands and upcoming ones especially from Japan. I went on a weekday and the mall seems too quiet with not much crowd. Perhaps as stores are only about only 65% open. I will visit again soon when it's fully open. Looking forward to the Japanese brands.

Why are all the free indoor playgrounds/play areas being removed one by one?

There used to be a play area on Level 1 and Level 2, and two play areas at Level 4 inside the food court. But now, only the one on Level 1 remains-and it's not very big either. It gets extremely crowded on weekends.

Please consider bringing back more free play areas. They really encourage families with children, like mine, to shop and dine at your mall. In fact, the free play areas were the main reason we decided to visit in the first place.

places.address: 2, Jln Hang Tuah, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
